de.bit.pl02.pp5.task02

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.bit.pl02.pp5.task02.Database

  • public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    The class Database can be used to create database objects and helps the user to interact with them. The user can give a directory in the read_director(String) method from which a table will be created with the images and the corresponding metadata. It is possible to print the values of the created table with the method see_table(). If the user only wants the metadata of a specific sample, then the metadata can be retrieved by specifying either the author or the title with the get_meta(String, String, String) method and be saved as a .txt file. The user can add images with the updatePicture(Image, int, String) method to the table. Columns: AUTHOR the name of the author TITLE the name of the title LINK the URL related to the image PICUTRE the image as a byte array
    Author:
    Shreya Kapoor, Sophia Krix, Gemma van der Voort

      • read_director

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> read_director(java.lang.String dir)
                                                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Reads the files of a directory, finds the images and its corresponding metadata. Inserts the metadata of ID, TITLE and AUTHOR into the database and inserts the image into the PICTURE blob column via the updatePicture(Image, int, String) method.
        Parameters:
        dir - the path of the directory
        Returns:
        arr the SQL commands
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if image could not be inserted into database

      • updatePicture

        public void updatePicture(Image img,
                          int Id,
                          java.lang.String path)
        Updates the database with the new image by using the method Image.readFile(String) to read in an image file and store it as a byte array.
        Parameters:
        img - the image to be stored
        Id - the value of the id column in the database
        path - the path of the image to be stored

      • storePictureForAPI

        public void storePictureForAPI(byte[] bytes,
                               java.lang.String author,
                               java.lang.String title,
                               java.lang.String link)
        MODIFIED FOR API Updates the database with the new image by using the method Image.readFile(String) to read in an image file and store it as a byte array.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte array of the image
        author - the value of column AUTHOR
        title - the value of column TITLE
        link - the value of column LINK

      • getForAPI

        public java.util.List<MetaDataAPI> getForAPI(java.lang.String author,
                                             java.lang.String title)
        FOR API USE function returns a list of id's and metadata that matches the get command author and/or title. Cannot both be null!
        Parameters:
        author - the value of column AUTHOR to be searched
        title - the value of column TITLE to be search
        Returns:
        MetaDataList the list of id and metadata command author and/or title. CANNOT BOTH BE NULL!

      • getForAPI

        public byte[] getForAPI(int id)
        FOR API USE returns byte[] of picture with identifier id. Since id is unique, this function returns only 1 byte[]. overloaded
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier id
        Returns:
        image the byte array of the image

      • get_byteImage

        public void get_byteImage(java.lang.String column_name,
                          java.lang.String value,
                          java.lang.String outputpath)
        Takes a String with value of column AUTHOR or TITLE, retrieves image in column PICTURE blob and stores the image in specified outputpath.
        Parameters:
        column_name - the String of the column name
        value - the String of the value of column AUTHOR or TITLE in the database
        outputpath - the output path of the retrieval

      • get_meta

        public void get_meta(java.lang.String column_name,
                     java.lang.String value,
                     java.lang.String outputpath)
        Takes value of AUTHOR or TITLE column and saves the corresponding metadata as a .txt file
        Parameters:
        value - the value of the specified column
        column_name - either AUTHOR or TITLE
        outputpath - the output path for the retrieval
